intro: Galium thracicum, commonly known as Thrace bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southeastern Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white to pale pink flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium thracicum typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
